aggregate_function.description: The aggregate function determines how the KPI is calculated and can be either AVG (Average) or SUM (Total Sum)

category_id.description: The id of the category the KPI is in

created_at.description: The UTC date and time the KPI was created. Date time format without timezone, e.g. `2019-01-01T00:00:00`

icon_id.description: The id of the icon to assign to the KPI

is_active.description: Active KPIs can have date entered against them otherwise they are display only KPIs

is_calculated.description: Calculated KPIs cannot be amended via the API and must be added / amended in the interface

sort_order.description: The display order of the KPI

target_default.description: The default target value for the KPI. If left blank or null the KPI will not have a target

unit_id.description: The id of the unit of measure to assign to the KPI

updated_at.description: The UTC date and time the KPI was updated. Date time format without timezone, e.g. `2019-01-01T00:00:00`

value_direction.description: The value direction is case sensitive and can only be U(p), D(own) and N(one)

actual.description: The actual value cannot be null if the target and notes are both null

created_at.description: The UTC date and time the KPI entry was created. Date time format without timezone, e.g. `2019-01-01T00:00:00`

entry_date.description: The date of the entry. Date time format without timezone, e.g. `2019-01-01T00:00:00`

id.description: Automatically generated for the KPI entry

kpi_id.description: The kpi must be active and cannot be a calculated KPI. The KPI must also be assigned to the user

notes.description: The note associated with the KPI entry

target.description: The target value of the entry. This value will be ignored if the KPI has a null target

updated_at.description: The UTC date and time the KPI entry was updated. Date time format without timezone, e.g. `2019-01-01T00:00:00`

user_id.description: An id of an active user to assign to the KPI entry

get.description: The KPI entries are filtered based on the search query string. All the search criteria is optional and we will return a maximum of 500 entries per page. If the result set has the amount of rows you set `&rows=100`, it's your responsibility to check the next page to see if there are any more -- you do this by adding &page=2 to the query, then &page=3 and so on.

post.description: The KPI entries are filtered based on the search query string. All the search criteria is optional and we will return a maximum of 500 entries per page. If the result set has the amount of rows you set `&rows=100`, it's your responsibility to check the next page to see if there are any more -- you do this by adding &page=2 to the query, then &page=3 and so on.
